repo.name: python-lsp-server
repo.description: Fork of the python-language-server project, maintained by the Spyder IDE team and the community

readme.summary: Comprehensive installation and configuration documentation but lacks practical usage examples and quick-start guidance for new users.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start example showing how to actually use the LSP server with an editor or client - just installation commands without demonstrating what to do next

common_complaints: CPU usage spikes to 100% causing hangs (open since 2022)
Test suite hangs and never exits after recent commits
Rename functionality returns empty results
Timeout errors during LSP operations
Dependency management issues (unnecessary dependencies)
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor with critical unfixed bugs spanning multiple years (CPU hangs since 2022, recent test failures), minimal maintainer engagement evidenced by slow response to issues, and no positive user feedback in the issue queue.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being in December 2025
164 open issues with no recent closure activity
Zero merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release cycle has stopped
maintenance.summary: python-lsp-server appears abandoned with no development activity, issue resolution, or PR merging in the past 6 months despite a large backlog of open issues.

project_metrics.description: Fork of the python-language-server project, maintained by the Spyder IDE team and the community
